name: Store Matching - Burger Index
description: A machine learning system for comparing store data from multiple food delivery platforms to identify common and duplicate stores. The system was used for comparative data analysis and correction of incorrectly tagged data.
role: Led data science efforts by collaborating with the client to identify, collect, and curate data for feature generation
Developed a traditional NLP-based tagging system and labeled approximately 40,000 samples with human-in-the-loop validation
Experimented with multiple machine learning and deep learning approaches, including fully connected neural networks and Siamese networks, to predict store similarity scores
Applied geofencing and geohashing techniques to cluster nearby stores and reduce the candidate matching space, improving system efficiency
Used the system to identify and eliminate duplicate store entries extracted by web crawlers
Achieved 96% accuracy and successfully processed over 500,000 store records in production
